html:
Roles, voice types, premiere cast
Role Voice type Premiere cast, 31 August 1928[21]
Conductor: Theo Mackeben
Macheath ("Mackie Messer"/"Mack the Knife"), London's greatest and most notorious criminal tenor/baritone
Jonathan Jeremiah Peachum, the "Beggar's Friend", controller of all the beggars in London; conspires to have Mack hanged baritone
Celia Peachum ("Frau Peachum"), Peachum's wife; helps him run the business mezzo-soprano
Polly Peachum, the Peachums' daughter; after knowing Mack for only five days, agrees to marry him soprano
Jackie "Tiger" Brown, Police Chief of London and Mack's best friend from their army days baritone
Lucy Brown, Tiger Brown's daughter; claims to be married to Mack soprano
Jenny ("Spelunken-Jenny"/"Low-Dive Jenny"/"Ginny Jenny"), a prostitute once romantically involved with Macheath; is bribed to turn Mack over to the police mezzo-soprano
Filch, a misfit young man who approaches the Peachums in hopes of beggar training tenor
Street Singer ("Moritatensänger"), sings 'The Ballad of Mack the Knife' in the opening scene baritone
Smith, a constable baritone
Walter tenor
Matthias tenor
Jakob tenor
Jimmie tenor
Ede tenor
Beggars, gangsters, whores, constables

items.role: Macheath ("Mackie Messer"/"Mack the Knife"), London's greatest and most notorious criminal
Jonathan Jeremiah Peachum, the "Beggar's Friend", controller of all the beggars in London; conspires to have Mack hanged

Lucy Brown, Tiger Brown's daughter; claims to be married to Mack
Jenny ("Spelunken-Jenny"/"Low-Dive Jenny"/"Ginny Jenny"), a prostitute once romantically involved with Macheath; is bribed to turn Mack over to the police
Filch, a misfit young man who approaches the Peachums in hopes of beggar training
Street Singer ("Moritatensänger"), sings 'The Ballad of Mack the Knife' in the opening scene
